required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Real-world Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Surufatinib in the Treatment of Biliary Tract Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Real-world Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Surufatinib in the Treatment of Biliary Tract Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, single-arm, open-label,multi-center, observational real-world clinical study to observe and evaluate the efficacy and safety of Surufatinib in the treatment of patients with biliary tract cancer (BTC).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, single-arm, open-label,multi-center, observational real-world clinical study to observe and evaluate the efficacy and safety of Surufatinib in the treatment of patients with biliary tract cancer (BTC). About 200 subjects are prepared to recruit in the study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the last patient enrolled
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the length of time from the administration of the first-dose until disease progression or death from any cause before disease progression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 4 weeks after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of AE and SAE in patients with BTC receiving surufatinib,AEs/SAEs were evaluated using NCI-CTCAE v5.0

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the last patient enrolled
secondary_outcome.description: DCR was defined as the percentage of patients with complete response (CR), partial response (PR) and stable disease (SD) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the last patient enrolled
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the length of time from the administration of the first-dose until death from any cause. or lost of follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the last patient enrolled
secondary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the percentage of patients with complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST).

other_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the last patient enrolled
other_outcome.description: Using quality of life questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30) to collect the score. Scale range is 30~126, higher values are considered to be a better outcome.
Explore the correlation between curative effect and different biomarkers, such as EGFR mutation, FGFR etc.

arm_group.description: Patients with BTC visited the site from 2021 to 2023 and received Surufatinib therapy.

intervention.description: The study is a real-world study. According to the actual medical history of patients, the usage of Surufatinib was collected.
